result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LEIGH M BEEBE

records.addlTxt:
3:02 PM - Defendant LEIGH M BEEBE in court, in custody.  Attorney Lester H Liptak in court for LEIGH M BEEBE.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Plaintiff's witness, S. Stolarzyk, Officer Lake Hallie PD sworn in and testifies; identifies defendant in Courtroom.  Exhibit 1 is offered and received.  Attorney Liptak cross examines witness, S.S.
Court finds felony charge and binds defendant over for arraignment.
Attorney Liptak states he has a copy of Information and mirrors charges in complaint
Attorney Liptak enters Not Guilty pleas on all 4 counts.
Attorney Liptak requests 30 days to file any motions; granted.  If any motions filed, hearing to be held outside of intake.
Defendant may appear by video from Jackson Correctional or in person with a transport order.
Status conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff.
Video conference - Dodge Correctional - Sent for review
Preliminary hearing on October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant LEIGH M BEEBE appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless in court for LEIGH M BEEBE. 
Preliminary Hearing adjourned until Attorney Lester Liptak is available. 
Bond continued.
